exam.title: Departamento de Idiomas. Escuela de Guerra | INGLÉS
exam.intro1: En las sucesivas presentaciones usted encontrará preguntas de tipo test relacionadas con la conversación que debe escuchar previamente en la parte izquierda de la misma.
exam.intro2: Después de escuchar la conversación en inglés deberá responder a una de las preguntas de la parte derecha.
exam.intro3: Gracias por su colaboración. A continuación podrá imprimir las respuestas que han sido seleccionadas, o bien imprimirlas en un archivo pdf para su entrega al profesor correspondiente.
exam.timeOver: Su tiempo ha terminado. Pulse finalizar e imprima sus respuestas

question.Text:
1.  The Mobile Phone. ……Listen to a conversation about a mobile phone.What is the man trying to do with the mobile phone?
DEPARTAMENTO

answers.answ1: a) Take a photo
answers.answ2: b) Phone somebody
answers.answ3: c) Check his emails
answers.answ4: d) Iron his shirt

question.Text: 2. The Weekend. ……Listen to a dialogue betweem two friends about the weekendWhat did Bill, the second speaker, do on the weekend?

answers.answ1: a) He read ‘Harry Potter’.
answers.answ2: b) He went out to dinner
answers.answ3: c) He saw a film
answers.answ4: d) He stayed at home

question.Text: 3. A motivated worker ……Listen to a woman talking about her jobWhich statement is correct about the speaker?

answers.answ1: a) She is very happy in her job
answers.answ2: b) She dislikes travelling
answers.answ3: c) She has a small sales territory
answers.answ4: d) She is in the same place every day

question.Text: 4. The Jumper. ……Listen to a conversation about a jumper.How does the woman feel about the jumper?

answers.answ1: a) She thinks it is very expensive
answers.answ2: b) She likes its style
answers.answ3: c) She believes it is old fashioned
answers.answ4: d) She dislikes the color

question.Text: 5. Living in Colleta di Castelbianco ……In the following extract, a speaker talks about the place in which she livesFor the interviewee, what is the most important thing about Colleta?

answers.answ1: a) There are lots of graphic designers
answers.answ2: b) Her husband’s clients are nearby
answers.answ3: c) Flats are cheap
answers.answ4: d) It is a good place to work in

question.Text: 6. Sporting event ……Listen to this commentator at a sporting eventWhich sentence is correct according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: a) It is very windy
answers.answ2: b) The weather is favourable
answers.answ3: c) The men’s singles is on court one
answers.answ4: d) Belarus have lost their match

question.Text: 7. Palm Springs. ……Listen to an extract from a report about the American city, Palm Springs.What is said about Palm Springs?

answers.answ1: a) Movies were made there
answers.answ2: b) People used to go there for health reasons
answers.answ3: c) Doctors warned against the heat there
answers.answ4: d) Many architects live there

question.Text: 8. Titanic. ……The following is an extract from a report about the Titanic.What is said about Titanic’s passengers?

answers.answ1: a) Most of them were famous
answers.answ2: b) Most travelled in modest conditions
answers.answ3: c) Most were from New York
answers.answ4: d) Most were first class passengers

question.Text: 9. Paul Stewart and Chris Riddell. ……The following is an extract from an interview with a writer.Which activity did the speaker enjoy when he was young?

answers.answ1: a) Reading
answers.answ2: b) Writing
answers.answ3: c) Drawing
answers.answ4: d) Walking

question.Text: 10. Team Meeting. ……The following dialogue takes place at an office team meeting.What happened to the man?

answers.answ1: a) He missed the meeting
answers.answ2: b) He opened the meeting
answers.answ3: c) He arrived late for the meeting
answers.answ4: d) He forgot about the meeting

question.Text: 11. A black family in Coventry……In the following extract, the speaker talks about being black in CoventryWhich statement is correct according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: a) Rare sights were frequent in Coventry
answers.answ2: b) The speaker was the only black student in his school
answers.answ3: c) It was common to see black children in schools
answers.answ4: d) Traffic jams were usual in Coventry in the 1960s

question.Text: 12. Discussing a film ……Listen to the following conversationWhere can be said about the speakers?

answers.answ1: a) They all have the same opinion
answers.answ2: b) They are having an argument
answers.answ3: c) They are discussing a film
answers.answ4: d) They are discussing an actor’s performance

question.Text: 13. The colour of food ……Listen to the following extract about the colour of foodWhich statement is correct according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: a) The natural colour of food is not good
answers.answ2: b) People prefer food that’s colourful
answers.answ3: c) Food companies add colouring to products
answers.answ4: d) Yellow margarine tastes better

question.Text: 14. In the Office. ……Listen to the following dialogue between office workers.What doesn’t Anna want to do?

answers.answ1: a) Take a message
answers.answ2: b) Answer the phone
answers.answ3: c) Make a phone call
answers.answ4: d) Teach a lesson

question.Text: 15. Being on TV ……Listen to a man talk about being on tvWhat does the man say about being on TV?

answers.answ1: a) He dislikes being noticed
answers.answ2: b) People recognise him everywhere
answers.answ3: c) Old ladies follow him around
answers.answ4: d) He looks younger

question.Text: 16. Commentary ……Listen to this commentary from a football stadiumWhich statement is correct?

answers.answ1: a) The match hasn’t started yet
answers.answ2: b) The match is in Japan
answers.answ3: c) It is a calm, sunny day
answers.answ4: d) The speaker feels cold

question.Text: 17. Psychic powers ……The following is an extract about psychic powersWhat is said about psychic powers?

answers.answ1: a) Practice can develop psychic abilities
answers.answ2: b) Few people can develop them
answers.answ3: c) You need expert help to develop them
answers.answ4: d) It is easy to write about them

question.Text: 18. Barbara Martinsons ……Listen to an extract about Barbara Martinsons What can we say about Barbara Martinsons?

answers.answ1: a) She has spent time in prison
answers.answ2: b) She wants to help ex-prisoners
answers.answ3: c) She wants to be admitted to a university
answers.answ4: d) She freed a lot of women prisoners

question.Text: 19. Bio-gas systems ……You are going to hear a woman talk about building bio-gas systems in IndiaWhich statement is correct about the project?

answers.answ1: a) It is run in all national parks
answers.answ2: b) Its bio-gas systems are very up-to-date
answers.answ3: c) Bio-gas produced can be used for fuel and fertilizer
answers.answ4: d) The technology used is expensive

question.Text: 20. Scottish Military History.……The following is a report on Scottish military history.What is said about the military in Scotland?

answers.answ1: a) It has always been important
answers.answ2: b) It has lost its influence
answers.answ3: c) It is no longer respected
answers.answ4: d) It is opposed to the union

question.Text: 21. Dull and Boring. ……The following is a report about a Scottish village called ‘Dull’.What is said about the village ‘Dull’ ?

answers.answ1: a) It is an interesting place to live
answers.answ2: b) It is still a religious village
answers.answ3: c) It is not very exciting
answers.answ4: d) No-one lives there now

question.Text: 22. US Army specialist ……Listen to a US Army specialist Which statement is correct about the man interviewed?

answers.answ1: a) He had been a journalist in Iraq
answers.answ2: b) He did not see war first hand
answers.answ3: c) He understands how the troops feel
answers.answ4: d) He would love to return to Iraq

question.Text: 23. China’s population……The following is an extract about ChinaWhat can we say about China?

answers.answ1: a) The birth rate is increasing
answers.answ2: b) The birth rate has decreased
answers.answ3: c) The one-child policy was a failure
answers.answ4: d) Couples can now have more children

question.Text: 24. First career 1+/-2 B……Listen to a woman describe her first careerWhy did the speaker want to be interpreter?

answers.answ1: a) To learn more languages
answers.answ2: b) To learn a lot about different subjects
answers.answ3: c) To get a superficial notion of things
answers.answ4: d) To be able to express opinions

question.Text: 25. Immunization in New Zealand ……Listen to an extract about Immunization in New Zealand What is said about immunization in New Zealand?

answers.answ1: a) The rates surpass those in other developed nations.
answers.answ2: b) There is ‘herd immunity’ for most diseases.
answers.answ3: c) The rates are still not sufficient.
answers.answ4: d) NZ has a 95% immunization rate.

question.Text: 26. Teaching science to teenagers ……Listen to an passage about Teaching teenagers scienceWhat impression do we get from the extract?

answers.answ1: a) Pupils organize question and answer sessions
answers.answ2: b) Teenage pupils are extremely curious about science
answers.answ3: c) The speaker does not like pupils to question him
answers.answ4: d) In science class the teacher has no weak points

question.Text: 27. Jerome Kerviel ……The following is an extract about banker Jerome KervielWhich statement is correct about Jerome Kerviel?

answers.answ1: a) He is going to appeal again
answers.answ2: b) He has paid back the bank
answers.answ3: c) He will spend three years in jail
answers.answ4: d) He lost six thousand dollars

question.Text: 28. Skydiving ……Listen to the following conversationWhat is the conversation about?

answers.answ1: a) A parachute jump by Sean Connery
answers.answ2: b) Skydiving without a parachute
answers.answ3: c) Squirrels that skydive
answers.answ4: d) Special outfits for skydiving

question.Text: 29. Oil. ……Listen to an extract from a report on oil.Which aspect of oil is the report concerned with?

answers.answ1: a) Damage to the environment caused by drilling
answers.answ2: b) Western relations with oil producing countries
answers.answ3: c) Recently discovered sources of oil
answers.answ4: d) Humanity’s dependency on oil

question.Text: 30. Fainting ……You will now hear a woman speak about faintingWhich statement is correct?

answers.answ1: a) Being in a contest
answers.answ2: b) Having to make a big effort
answers.answ3: c) Insufficient oxygen to the brain
answers.answ4: d) High blood pressure

question.Text: 31. Wind Turbines ……The following is an extract about Wind TurbinesWhat can be said about the speaker’s wind turbines?

answers.answ1: a) They are still inefficient
answers.answ2: b) They are bigger than conventional ones
answers.answ3: c) They do not vibrate
answers.answ4: d) They are economical at the moment

question.Text: 32. Minimalist house ……Listen to an extract about the home of architect, Gary Chang According to the speaker:

answers.answ1: a) Mr. Chang has modified his apartment.
answers.answ2: b) Mr. Chang has bought wheels to decorate his house
answers.answ3: c) He has just painted his apartment walls.
answers.answ4: d) Renovating his apartment took a long time.

question.Text: 33. Iraq ten years on……The following is an extract from a report on IrakWhat can be understood from the text?

answers.answ1: a) The iraquis laugh at their problems
answers.answ2: b) A positive view of the Iraqui people
answers.answ3: c) There is lasting peace in Iraq now
answers.answ4: d) There has been an Arab Spring

question.Text: 34. Aviation ……Listen to this extract about aviation after the Second World WarWhat impression do we get about aviation after WW II ?

answers.answ1: a) Jet technology was very advanced
answers.answ2: b) Many passenger planes crashed
answers.answ3: c) Fatal accidents were not very common
answers.answ4: d) Accidents were usual in military training

question.Text: 35. Hair implants ……The following is an extract from a report on tourism in TurkeyWhich sentence is correct about Turkey?

answers.answ1: a) It is difficult to sell holidays there
answers.answ2: b) Plastics surgery is cheap there
answers.answ3: c) Plastic surgery and holidays are combined
answers.answ4: d) Tourists shop for the cheapest operation

question.Text: 36. Flying ……Listen to this extract about Felix BaumgartnerWhat is inferred about Felix?

answers.answ1: a) He parachuted as a child
answers.answ2: b) He did his first jump at twelve
answers.answ3: c) He dreamed of skydiving as a child
answers.answ4: d) His Mum drew a picture of his first jump

question.Text: 37. The internet ……Listen to two people discuss the InternetWhat do the speakers say?

answers.answ1: a) They had computers when they were at school
answers.answ2: b) They had internet in university
answers.answ3: c) They are too old to use computers
answers.answ4: d) They remember when there was no internet

question.Text: 38. A train journey ……Sirou told Matthew Bannister about the fateful night he boarded a train with his brother.Which statement is correct?

answers.answ1: a) Two brothers went on a trip to Calcutta
answers.answ2: b) A small boy got on a train and fell asleep
answers.answ3: c) A man saw the boy in the train station
answers.answ4: d) Little boys always sleep in train stations

question.Text: 39. US clothing trends ……Listen to an extract about clothing trendsWhich statement is correct according to the extract?

answers.answ1: a) Consumers prefer designer clothes
answers.answ2: b) Clothes made outside the US are more in demand
answers.answ3: c) Consumers now want clothes made in the US
answers.answ4: d) Textile companies do not want to change

question.Text: 40. Being a student in Japan ……Listen to part of an interview with a student from JapanWhat can be said about students in Japan?

answers.answ1: a) They get bank loans to study
answers.answ2: b) Many work as well as study
answers.answ3: c) The families don’t pay
answers.answ4: d) A majority get scholarships
